website_summaries.verdict: Very sturdy and heavy, this heat press handles daily use well, though newer users can be frustrated by minimal instructions.
pros: Well-built, sturdy, and lasts for years, users report
Tweaking temperature and timing is easy
cons: Very heavy – not easy to take out and put away regularly
Non-anchored press makes opening during use difficult
Most owners have trouble getting initial settings right

customer_reviews.title: My first project was 12 shirts. On the larger ...
customer_reviews.text: My first project was 12 shirts. On the larger shirts the design wasn't adhering well consistently in the same area. I ordered an infrared heat gun thermometer and found the left side to be consistently 40 degrees less than the right side. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Psalm 127

customer_reviews.title: Great heat press for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an affordable heat press as I had just gotten into making shirts and I didn't want to use a iron most of the ones I saw were into the 300$ range cheapest. I was recommended this one and I've made plenty of shirts. It's great ! Affordable and does a great job . I would recommend buying extra teflon sheets I've heat pressed hats, headbands, baby clothes , stuffed animals, etc. I've had this heat press for 5 months bows and works like the first time I used it
customer_reviews.author: Esther Botello

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS HEAT PRESS, SIMPLE TO USE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I searched high and low for the perfect heat press for a small business that my sister and I have. After reading reviews and comparing several different heat presses, we decided to go with this one! What a great decision! The first night we used it, we did over 20 shirts with no problems! Takes about 15 minutes to heatup and although no instructions were included, its simple to figure out. Big press, but not huge. Came with teflon sheet that we attached to the top with magnets to avoid having to place on top the tshirts for each press. Once you figure out how much tension you need, its perfect! Would definitely recommend this heatpress! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: tiffany mitch

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews. My sister and my mom own this and love it, so I went ahead and took a chance. This product arrived damaged. The pressure adjuster came out of the box already broken. I couldn’t even grab it to adjust without the handle. Are these products inspected before they’re sent? I am returning it, but I requested a replacement. We will see if the second go round changes my review. If it arrives broken again, I’ll be requesting a refund. I’ll update my review once it’s received.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Logan

customer_reviews.title: I refer this to all of my customers
customer_reviews.text: I have a vinyl business and I get asked all the time what kind of heat press should they get for pressing shirts.. I always recommend this one. It's easy to use and you never have to change anything. PERFECT!!! It also comes in different colors.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Williams

customer_reviews.title: Worst.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it no stars I would worst heat press I have ever used. Worked for about a month then completely stopped working turns off every 5 seconds Smells like burnt wire and can hear a sizzle noise. Scared it's gonna catch fire. When trying to reach customer service they are no help at all and expect you to cover return cost which is more then 100 bucks. If you are thinking about buying this machine please think twice you will just have a really big paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel R.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous machine.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. The package was fine and looks decent, but the machine itself don’t last long. After several uses, when I turned the power on, a black smokes comes out of the machine, and it suddenly stopped working. I immediately turned it off, otherwise might have fire harzard. Think twice before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Murray

customer_reviews.title: Fancierstudios Heat Press
customer_reviews.text: *Edit* Fancierstudios sent me a new press that works fine. I will update my review in a few months. PURCHASE AT YOUR OWN RISK I really can’t rate how easy it is to use because IT DOESNT WORK! Straight out of the box, the screen won’t even light up, never heated up. fancierstudios is very hush hush about contacting them. It took me forever to find their real site, when I hit contact, it went to an empty screen. I called the customer service and it was a regular voicemail. I’m very disappointed thinking I was getting a quality heatpress. I’m returning it and taking my money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Karynthia

customer_reviews.title: It won't stay closed. NO WAY to contact seller
customer_reviews.text: Just outside of my return window, this press quit staying closed for me and I have NO way to contact the seller, and no recourse. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Nope!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked just over a year and now shuts off. Very pricey considering it doesn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kienbusch

customer_reviews.title: My wife liked using it also so I got her one for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I have purchased for a gift. Bought my daughter one for Christmas. She has used it to make custom clothing. My wife liked using it also so I got her one for her birthday. Both of them love the unit and the ease of operation. Big hit, would have anyone interested to check this one out. The price is great also.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Alloway

customer_reviews.title: Easy to  use right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to use. I googled the appropriate heat settings and fired it right up. Just plug it in and go! It has everything you need to get started. Customer service was great too. I got a few follow up emails to make sure I knew didn't need help getting it working. It warms up the room quite a bit, but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R

customer_reviews.title: Great Press! Make the investment and get rid of your iron!
customer_reviews.text: After buying my Cricut and wanting to make t-shirts I quickly learned that no matter how many articles I read trying to make it work my iron just wasn't going to cut it. I purchased this after reading thousands of reviews on presses in this price range (like you're doing right now). I waited 9 months to write this review to make sure it was still working as expected. I LOVE IT! My hobby has turned into a side business and my iron is back to doing it's intended job...ironing (not pressing). Great heat press for the price point!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heat
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely uneven heat all over the plate and a god awful smell
customer_reviews.author: Shawna heart Legg

customer_reviews.title: Very rude customer service
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this with the extended warranty.. Well the top plate started chipping just 2 months after getting it. Contacted customer service to be greeted with the worst "floor manager" I have ever encountered. Condescending, talked over me constantly. I will be looking into returning this press and going with something different. Absolutely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: ... 3 years and this one is by far my favorite. I use it everyday since I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: **Update** Year later.. still working and still amazing! **orginal review** I have bought about 7 heat presses in the last 3 years and this one is by far my favorite. I use it everyday since I have a small tshirt company. Heats up fast. Doesn't lift up when opening up the clamshell. Base is narrow so works great if you have a small table for it. The metal bar did get a metal screw which made an awful noise so I bought the padded stickers you put on the bottom of furniture, put it on top of the screw and it's not as loud anymore. Best heat press I have had so far :)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one in 60 days dead.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second press the first never worked out if the box. The second worked for a few weeks. When it worked it was amazing. That’s entirely too much money to spend on something that now in my opinion has a dead control board. We unboxed it and it’s never moved so very well cared for, but dead!! Don’t buy this press! Run far far away. If the seller chooses to resolve this I will modify my review with any updates. Nothing so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grice

customer_reviews.title: Don’t not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a month, and then just quit working. It started beeping and wouldn’t stop. I googled and it said the temp controller wasn’t working. After researching, this is pretty common. I contacted the business and they said it had probably been dropped or missing parts, and then said it probably needed a new temperature controller. It was quite disappointing considering it worked perfect for just a month. Hopefully they can get that fixed. They refunded me, but this machine is heavy and was a pain to take to a fedex location. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Top plate peeling less than a month old
customer_reviews.text: Love the press but top plate is peeling already and less than a month old. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Item falling apart after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Item fell apart after the first use, padding peeled off and warped. Stickers on the machine did the same, leaving behind nasty sticky stuff. Very dissatisfied, I purchased a second of these thinking it was a faulty purchase but had the exact same problem!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Vigil

customer_reviews.title: I love this and I took forever deciding what kind to ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this and I took forever deciding what kind to get because of the negative reviews. I love how easy this is to work and my whole family is able to use it to make shirts. I have had it a year and still love it. It is very heavy and you need a sturdy table to sit it on
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: All around great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Has really stepped up my game!! Only thing I would ask is that they would send a better direction packet. Literally just says plug in and done lol. I want more detailed explanations and times and temperatures. Love the product though. So far no puckers in my vinyl and it’s so quick to heat and quick to press 10 seconds and done. I am a home crafter that sells stuff in the local store on Main st so I produce a lot of product if that helps too!
customer_reviews.author: Christianchic

customer_reviews.title: Looks used straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: It has heat stains on upper inside some of the bottom mat has gashes and the plastic wasn’t even covering half of the item when I opened the box. It was in styrofoam well so I can’t figure out where all the paint chips and gashes came from since it wasn’t shipping. I tried using it according to preset pressure and some videos on temperature But first wash and off comes the vinyl. I’m going to give it another shot with higher temps more pressure and longer time if that doesn’t work this bad boy is going back.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: This heat press arrived damaged and the plates were misaligned. I was going to just roll with that and keep it but then the pressure knob came completely off during my first use. I had to adjust the pressure with pliers. I am waiting to hear back from the seller regarding return and a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Carley Rousse

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this item. I’m not able to use it for vinyl because the pressure is not tight enough h and won’t lock. (yes I’ve tightened it as much as I possibly can) Every time I call the number, it goes to a random voicemail and I’ve also emailed customer service and haven’t heard anything.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Benson

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: First off, there is no lock on the plates. It stays open all the time. Second, it stops working...right outside the return window. Even fresh out of the box it sucked, but I thought maybe I was doing something wrong. I used the recommended settings from Siser North America. Didn't work. Increased temp/time just a tad and it bubbled and melted the vinyl. Now there are dead spots on the plate where it heats at a totally different temperature. DO NOT BUY THIS THING!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ravenclaw74

customer_reviews.title: Great press
customer_reviews.text: After looking at many different heat presses for my HTV vinyl projects, I finally decided on this one due to the reviews it got and the price. I was unsure going into it if I had made the right decision but after some trial and error on my part, it was the best purchase I made. I've made tons of projects from onsies, tshirts and sweatshirts and love how easy it is to press and feel much more comfortable giving my designs away knowing that the vinyl has been pressed correctly!
customer_reviews.author: Shay B

customer_reviews.title: stop working
customer_reviews.text: i bought this heat press exactly a year ago and it has stopped working. right in the middle of me doing a t-shirt order. this is costing me time and money for my business and is unacceptable at this point because no one is contacting me back.
customer_reviews.author: gwen mayo

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: There is a few quality issues but considering the price point not shocking! the top platen has scuff marks from factory, like adhesive was scrubbed off, sharp edges also on top platen and sharp enough to cut open a finger or hand at worse or material being pressed, filed it around entire edge, took all of a couple minutes so no excuse for not being done at factory before being coated. The top platen also had packing foam and paper wedged up under cover which could be a fire hazard,how it got wedged that deep had to mean it was there before shell ( cover) of top platen was wrapped prior to assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas  "CuDa"

customer_reviews.title: Super great heatpress for basic crafting.
customer_reviews.text: I got this when I had interest in screen printing, but now mainly use it for sublimation. Its very simple to adjust the temperature, and timer to your needs. It does take a while to heat up, so I usually turn it on right away when I know I'm going to need it, and prep my crafting while it heats up. The one thing I do not like about it, is that it's easy to burn yourself because its not a swivel press. But there is no avoiding that with this style press, so I don't see a reason to lower the rating.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Makes business a lot easier!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Unbox this morning and nothing was wrong with it. It did have a little grit feeling on the bottom plate but it easily wiped off. Made about 15 shirts within the first hour of having it. The only “bad” thing I have to say so far is that the handle is hard to open with my pressure setting. I’ve found it easier to lay on towel on the top and push down while pulling up on the handle. However, this is nothing major. Overall, very pleased. I can already see it’s going to be worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Keith

customer_reviews.title: the item look like it was use
customer_reviews.text: the pressure knob was loose and when u clamp down to do a shirt some part of the shirt will be darker color and the other half will be light color. it will have a smell of burn glue.when i call the customer number to the manufacture it said voicemail full it not accepting call right now unprofessional company...
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: It worked great, until it didn't
customer_reviews.text: I had this press for 11 months. It worked great, until it didn't. I powered it on one day and started to smell a burning smell. powered it off. Then took off the back to look and there was burnt wires. I know several people with this press that haven't had a problem, but mine did. So, if you do decide to but it... DON'T FORGET THE WARRENTY!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Heatpress for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I really like this heat press. It's very easy to use. It is ready to go right out of the box. I've been able to create awesome designs and know that they are gonna stay for a long time. It's Such a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Nola

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Item quit working within a year of purchase, contacted company and they did not care. Very frustrating for something so expensive to last less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Somethings not right...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one press and it came in excellent condition so I decided to order another for better production but this one didn’t come in the best of shape. The foam pad bubbles up and lifts up while using the press. It flattens when you press the lid down but as soon as you lift it, the pad rises again. I would like to speak with fancier studio about having it fixed or replaced.
customer_reviews.author: The Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Its so  dang exciting!
customer_reviews.text: I combine materials to make my earrings and was doing everything by hand with an iron LOL.. 5 seconds and my material is completely done! I work with leather and other materials and this is a life saver. It did take me an house to figure out the correct temps for my material but, once I did!! OMG GAME CHANGER.. item works great.. heats up fast.. and is super easy to use! Von Meyer Jewelry
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when removing the press from box it’s not clamped down and locked. Overall good press.
customer_reviews.text: I want to saw ... Their was a hiccup with my delivery in the beginning .. However, this company is great. The seller made sure their were no more problems. The communication was great! For a start up press .. I love it! I was referred by a friend and he loved it.. and so do I. Super easy to to use. The thing I did notice was the heat press mat lifts a little when you remove your shirt after pressing. I’ll probably have to find a way to tack it down a little bit so it won’t lift. Overall.. my first try at this.. awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't not have even pressure. DO NOT PURCHASE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this press 8 months. The temp difference from the front to the back of the press is almost 30 degrees. Their response to this problem is that it can be off by 20 degrees. And because they only cover it for 6 months, I'm out of luck. DO NOT PURCHASE!!! Custom service is zero help! If you are just doing vinyl, sure. But every screen print I have pressed with this has been burnt on the bottom half and won't stick on the top. Due to that big of a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Landon Moss

customer_reviews.title: Great for heat transfer vinyl.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Cricut heat press when I got my Cricut and it worked okay, but I couldn't always put enough pressure on it to make the vinyl stick completely. My husband bought this heat press for me and it works like a charm, the transfers look and stay on much more like professionally made shirts/items.
customer_reviews.author: Susie2shoes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After months of debating and reading way too much information on groups about irons, Easy Presses and a heat press, I just click buy...I am so glad I did. This press isn’t huge and it isn’t as heavy as I thought it would be. It is super easy to use and change my crafting life. If you are debating and overthinking this purchase, just stop and buy it! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Razz

customer_reviews.title: Box was badly damaged, unit appears ok though
customer_reviews.text: So I'll have to update this review once my wife actually fully unboxes the unit and uses it but I wanted to get this review up to validate some of these other reviews saying their's arrived damaged. Although I don't think my unit itself was damaged, one entire corner of the packaging was destroyed and the inner styrofoam was damaged. There was still a good amount of space until the unit though so I don't have any reason to believe the heat press itself was damaged in storage or transportation. Not sure where these things are coming from but they definitely don't seem to be kept in the world's greatest conditions. I'll update once we get it all set up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever heat press. I read many reviews and decided upon this one. I just started my T-Shirt business about two months ago and have already pressed at least 200 shirts with this press. Each one perfect. Nice, even heat. Really easy settings. It’s great all around. I have had no issues at all. I have burned myself with it a few times so watch out when your putting your shirts towards the back of the press but that is all. It is great and even better for the price! If business keeps up I may be purchasing a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great heat press
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had mine for a little under and year and have had zero problems with it. I use it for making shirts. My husband uses it to heat tortillas 🤷‍♀️ I feel like it is very easy to use and have recommended it several times!
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Received damaged/already used press for price of new
customer_reviews.text: My product came in damaged, it was all chipped on the front. I didn't think it was a big deal since it wouldn't effect the way I pressed but now I think that I received a "returned" press when I paid for a new one. It's VERY loud when you press stuff on high pressure. And I've had a screw pop off the back, it also has uneven tempature so I have to press the shirt in multiple spots. I didn't know better since this was my first press but now that I am more experienced I realize I was ripped off and now it's too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It worked for just 9 months
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this heat press last Christmas, and it worked, well enough for my hobby. The other day it just stopped heating, it doesn't go above 225, even though the display says 305. I tried troubleshooting with no luck. I am not recommending buying this heat press, it's just a heavy piece of scrap metal.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: It’s broken
customer_reviews.text: After taking the heat press out of the box, I noticed that the lid is broken. It had to have fallen pretty hard for this durable machine to crack this way. What do I do? I paid $180 for a cracked/broken machine. Please get back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Day

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: The switch kept going out on my other hest press so I ordered this as I needed something in a hurry. I wasn't sure I would like a clam shell after being use to a swing arm with a pull out bottom tray, but I love this machine. It is durable, sturdy, heats up fast and holda it's temperature. The one I replaced actually had heat fluctuation. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PJ B.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Used it to make 300 bags with decals, made ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it to make 300 bags with decals, made my life much easier and works well. It does take a bit to heat up. ***Follow up, I also used this to make two t-shirt quilts. They made apply the stabilizer quick and professional looking. Would recommend using a non stick sheet on top of the t-shirt so you don't ruin the front of the designs on the t-shrit. Got lots of compliments on how nice the quilt turned out. Handle is still strong and steady, not complaints on this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: S. Tefft

customer_reviews.title: Package received undamaged but the top heat plate was all scratched 🤔
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good machine, the item was very well packaged and didn’t arrive damaged on the outside, but when I opened it there were scratches all along the top plate. What’s weird is the rest of the machine looked like it was brand new...this is my first machine and I’m not entirely sure but I don’t think it’s supposed to look like that. I returned it immediately before even trying to use it
customer_reviews.author: Tat

customer_reviews.title: I use it for comics
customer_reviews.text: I use this press to press comics. I know alot of people review for t shirts but I know alot look for a press for comics and this one is amazing. Quick tip sand the plate before use its quick easy and your books will look 100 percent better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good press
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this press for a year now and absolutely no negative issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hofer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I got this one because it had the highest reviews on Amazon. I see now why it is so highly recommended. I have had it for a few months and it still works like the day I got it. Heats up quickly and instructions are in English and easy to use. Several of the reviews on other heat presses talked about the instructions being in a different language.
customer_reviews.author: amanda guzman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally receive my press to start making shirts, but was immediately diaappointed after first use. This press seems to heat unevenly. I evwn tried turning the shirt around to repress the other end more, but I shouldn't have to do that. It's going to be very time consuming. It's impossible for me to return it, don't have the box, not sure how to package it. Chalk it up as a loss.
customer_reviews.author: Toya

customer_reviews.title: Heat press
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller heart press from a different company. It doesn't work as well. The fancier studio is easy to use, great size for shirts. It came sooner then expected. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Tina C

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It heats up quickly. I've made a couple dozen shirts for co-workers with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ara

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First off when I first used the heat press my timer didn't work. Now I went in to use it today and the panel which shows timer and heat setting will not turn on. How am I suppose to use if I can't read the heat temp. I'm very upset!!! 2-6-2020
customer_reviews.author: J Todd

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: It is simple to use and simple to adjust the temperature and times. It did smell at 1st but I assume that’s normal. I have used it five time and it still smells a little when I heat up so I make sure the windows are open and I always put a fan on when in use. A couple of times I did have a hard time opening it but now I have no issues. I’m happy with it. I have made shirt and made blankets. It came with a heat transfer cover.
customer_reviews.author: sierramnq

customer_reviews.title: Huge Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Had less than 6 months and used only twice. Heated up first time had some problems trying to get it to work but it finally heated up. Tried to use for a second time and it just will not heat up. Just keeps flashing 67 no matter what I do. I adjusted temperature to 325 and it flashes the last digit and then goes back to 67. Won't ever buy again. My last was had bent arm and gash in metal plate but at least it heated up. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Mary W

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: was so excited unboxing and ready to use, then I noticed a lot of scratches and dents on the machine. The padding has a piece scrapped off, the metal frame of the machine has chipped areas . The machine looks used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 48 days
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this press, used it and something broke on it & the lid will not stay open. The number that came with my warranty paperwork is disconnected, the number I found on google says the voicemail is full & they aren't taking calls currently.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it’s been used
customer_reviews.text: Works fine... I’ve only pressed two things and both left weird marks in the vinyl. The upper platen has little areas of sticky residue on it like I got a model that has been used and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amie Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver, Throw your iron away!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy I purchased this heat press! After looking and looking this was the one with the most successful reviews, and I got the warranty, just in case, but I busted it out for the first time and it’s awesome! It takes me less than a min to finish heat pressing my items, whereas with an iron it took like 5 min per item! I’m very happy with it! The only improvement I would make would be an extra handle on the bottom of the heat press to make it easier to open!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: What a crafting game changer
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to wait a bit before I reviewed this. I had gotten this for Mother’s Day this year. Set up was simple and straight forward. I suggest working with opening and closing to get your right tightness before using the actual press. It does not take long to heat up and I have been able to do many projects with less effort than ever before! Honestly, I wish I had this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: FrableFamilyof9

customer_reviews.title: Great product and feels industrial...but easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This press is awesome!!! Glad I got the 15” by 15” as it is perfect for t shirts. My wife has a Cricut and is doing a lot of vinyl cuts for custom t shirts and was looking at the cricut brand heat press. It looks little and all plastic. This cost just a little more, is heavy metal and works great. You set the temp and the length of time you want for the heat press material and close the lid. The timer beeps and indicates you should open the lid. Easy!
customer_reviews.author: P Burns

customer_reviews.title: This press has been wonderful so far
customer_reviews.text: This press has been wonderful so far. We used it on a small batch of shirts (30) and it worked perfectly. The product came assembled and ready to use. Directions are minimal but it was easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: I really love this heat press
customer_reviews.text: I really love this heat press....it heats up quickly and every item that I have applied my transfers to have come out perfect. The work area is the right size for any shirt size. I had bought a very popular press prior to purchasing this one and I am so glad that I returned it and went with my second choice.
customer_reviews.author: S. Frempong

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: This measures smaller than 15x15. It is very light and lifts when opening. The press does not press evenly either. It does heat quickly, but it is more work to get it to press everywhere evenly. I had to clamp it to the table to keep it from lifting when I open it. Overall, I am not happy and will look into returning if it is not a major hassle for me.
customer_reviews.author: HA

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and great price
customer_reviews.text: My product was damaged had to return will still get another great price
customer_reviews.author: Chatika

customer_reviews.title: I was optimistic until I used it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this press mid September. I finally decided to get it out today and try it out along with my new sublimation stuff. It got extremely smoky in the house when I turned it on. I pressed a clean towel before trying a shirt in case there was something on the press. When I tried to just pre heat a shirt at 400 for 10 secs it burnt the shirt. I turned it down to 375, pressed another shirt again for 30 secs, it smoked really bad and burnt my sublimation paper even with the provided Teflon sheet over it!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Unreal box and product damaged
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived soaking wet and press doesn't work. I have a trade show this week and now I'm screwed
customer_reviews.author: ENZO

customer_reviews.title: Defective from new
customer_reviews.text: Glue all over top and bottom foam backing of press. Not even usable out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Mindflux

customer_reviews.title: Efficient heat press for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I'm big on looks, so I was taken aback by the appearance of this heat press upon first sight. When I opened the box, an unpleasant smell of fresh paint hit me, and then, I noticed the gaudy paint job and uneven craftsmanship. Made me wonder if the press was refurbished because it looked nothing like the sleek model I had researched. I've pressed heat transfer paper images, vinyl and rhinestone designs and its performance is SUPERB! No issues in that department!
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: The press was ok at first. But I started having problems after the 6 month warranty was up. The main problem was the top plate would drop when heating up to 400 degrees. I contacted the company and they said there was nothing they could do since the warranty was up.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Heating Element is Broke & Temperature Varies by Over 30 Degrees in Some Places
customer_reviews.text: This might do well for vinyl or other types of transfers. However, for sublimation I've been having a lot of issues with this. The temperature varies so much that it is almost impossible sublimate with. Furthermore there is a "dead" spot where it always remains cold, resulting in a dime sized spot on all sublimated fabrics. Also, the foam lower portion warped while heat pressing and the glue popped off. It has since settled back down and rebinded. But definitely not the best build quality.
customer_reviews.author: brad b

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good value!
customer_reviews.text: This sucker is heavy. I bought this to make some shirts for a group. Heats up in less than 5 minutes and does a great job. I used it for 144 shirts first day, and no issues so far. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ManWithABlog

customer_reviews.title: Don’t count on the free Teflon sheet
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box and haven’t used the heat press yet. The included Teflon sheet was rolled up and tucked in near the handle of the machine. The Teflon sheet has several oil spots on it from the oil of the machine hinge so I’m afraid I can’t use it on my shirts otherwise I will have oil on them. Disappointing because now I need to order Teflon sheets and wait longer before I can start using the press.! If the packers would be able to place the sheet in a different way in the box it could be avoided.
customer_reviews.author: L Salyers

customer_reviews.title: heat press works great.
customer_reviews.text: works for my company and is used daily to press vinyl onto shirts, sweaters, sweats, and hats. haven't had any issues whatsoever with it and have used it close to 200 times
customer_reviews.author: Brody E.

customer_reviews.title: Pro level heat press
customer_reviews.text: Best heat press for the money hands down! Feels and performs like a $800+ press easy. Has all the features except auto pop up. Feels sturdy and temp/time controls are a breeze. I tested the temp with an infrared and results were within 5° to 8° degrees. Ran over 30 shirts so far with great results.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: 3 months after the return date...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this press for about 8 months and until now it has worked fine. It recently started leaving stain spots on my fabrics and it has a cool spot that does not allow for a smooth press. I have wiped and dried it several times but the spot continues to stain my garments. And now the top won’t stay closed!!! Horrible product
customer_reviews.author: Christa Colomb

customer_reviews.title: Only had it 4 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this heat press for 4 months, and it is already becoming useless. The pressure is off balance, with more pressure on the left than the right side, and its causing designs not to transfer all the way on the right side of the machine. This is my third heat press purchase on Amazon, and it will be my last. They never last long, before the handles or the welding starts coming apart, but at least the others lasted at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: Criss

customer_reviews.title: Would have given it 5 stars but...
customer_reviews.text: Received my heat press and while it’s a good value for the money and works excellent, the top doesn’t stay down when in use. Not sure if the arm is broken or what but I have to hold it down in order to press. Kind of annoying but I had rather do that then to go through the hassle of returning and waiting for a replacement. Especially since I was 9 months pregnant when I received it and had a 25 count t shirt order due in 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simple set-up. Do not change default pressure gauge. Learn appropriate temperature.
customer_reviews.text: Machine is pretty simple to use, after doing research online with video from YouTube. Honestly, I was going to return before I did not understand how to correctly apply pressure and heat to make my t-shirts but now I am more comfortable, after making adjustments when watching online videos, that the product will work. I would have rated five stars but my first couple of attempts at making a shirt was not successful, and it could have every much been my fault, but I will hold up for another week to see if it works then alter review based on results.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Agbor

customer_reviews.title: Pressure quick applying.
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving three stars because after not even 60 days the pressure completely stopped working. I returned it and bought a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Annon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Heat press is sturdy and perfectly made. It was easy to learn how to use it. I made a shirt 10 minutes after taking press out of the box. Heats up quickly. I would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Demers

customer_reviews.title: Great over-all
customer_reviews.text: Heats up fairly quickly, seems to be constructed pretty solid, heats evenly. My only complaint is that at a certain level of pressure, it is really difficult to open and doesn't have a second handle to push off from. But, after the learning curve, I've found a good pressure level and technique. For the money, if you're willing to roll the dice on like 3-4 shirts while you learn or are already familiar, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas w

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I have had this heat press for about 7 months now and is my first heat press purchase. Its durable and very easy to use. It heats up fairly quickly as well. My only issue is how much room it takes up in my small craft room. I love the plate size. I do mainly onesies and t shirts, so this is perfect in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Taek B Kim

customer_reviews.title: Heat it up “open” should have been in the directions.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this hear press. I gave it 4 stars under easy to learn because the directions don’t inform you to heat it up open. That’s important. Also, I think mine may have been a return because the inside packaging looked like it had been messed with, plus the protective paper had some oil spots on it, like it had been used. Other than it works. It would be great if they would include a booklet/ cheat sheet on heat settings for different projects. It’s a great beginner heat press for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Cricketwhisle

customer_reviews.title: Great press and quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box and used it. Never had to touch a thing. Works beautifully and a great value. Going on 2 years of regular use. Believe in this one so much, I bought the same for my daughter as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: C&J Clements

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: A little overrated and overpriced if you ask me looking at other deals on here
customer_reviews.author: Robin Gau

customer_reviews.title: Great heat press
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s been great!! Super easy to use. Heats up really quickly. Does everything that’s it’s supposed to. Great size for shirts. Definitely would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Angela D. Cullum

customer_reviews.title: Love this press-saves time!
customer_reviews.text: my first heat press. I am a textile artist and handbag maker. This press is very easy to use and cuts my interfacing time down tremendously! I dont know how I ever lived without it!
customer_reviews.author: MeGo

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for crafters
customer_reviews.text: I received this for Christmas 2018 and I'm addicted. Super easy to use...love the bigger size to make t-shirts. Has timer that resets after each use. Placed on counter top and doesn't over heat underneath. Only drawback is that it can be hard to open at times.
customer_reviews.author: Brian and Debbie Davis

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The first press I got had a bent handle and the cover was popping off. Then they sent a replacement and that one wouldn’t stay level on a table so I returned that one and dealt with the first one. A couple months in and the press will not stay closed unless I hold the handle down. Extremely upset and there’s no way to try to get another replacement one even though they’ve sent me multiple bad presses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She seems to love it. I am enjoying the peace and quiet ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the wife. She took it and relocated to what was formerly my hobby room. Now the kids, friends and neighbors all have new shirts. Many, many ,many new shirts. So many new shirts i am contemplating buying a garment factory in India to lower costs. She seems to love it. I am enjoying the peace and quiet that i get when she goes and makes shirts. There should be an option to lower the volume of the beeping it makes when ready though. Those beeps disturb my tranquility.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Machine was great for the first few months, and now shorts out every five minutes. Am still waiting to hear back from the company, as I purchased the extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the color I ordered but works
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get the color that I order. I ordered blue and black. I received a greenish turquoise and black. I wish i would have gotten the color i ordered though. It came with a teflon sheet and an instruction booklet. It was packaged well. It works perfectly. I've used it three time so far and I haven't had any trouble with.
customer_reviews.author: Janet H.

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: I totally LOVE my heat press. It's big enough to do whatever I want to do with it and works perfectly for my vinyl business. After working with an industrial brand at work, I was afraid I would be disappointed but I wasn't. It's as nice as the one we use to use at my place of employment. When I'm making shirts, I'm in my own little world. My peaceful place. :) It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: dap1666

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this heat press!!! I originally bought an easy press and it wasn’t a “easy” as I had hoped. While the directions weren’t super helpful, I found some YouTube videos that did the trick. The only bad thing is I feel like it has an odor. I have only used it twice and it seems to be fading. Hopefully, it will be completely gone soon.
customer_reviews.author: JL7

customer_reviews.title: Very well built and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to heat press and this was very easy to use. It works very well and I have created some great t-shirts with this. It seems to heat up very quickly and hold its temperature. It’s very heavy and sturdy. I’m very happy with my decision to buy this one after lots of research.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeybeyes

product_meta.title: Fancierstudio Power Heat Press Digital Heat Press 15 x 15 Sublimation Heat Press Rhinestone Heat Press T-Shirt Heat Press FS15x15 BB
product_meta.description: Brand new model by Fancier--15-by-15-inch industrial-quality digital heat press with improvements from the previous model, including included sheet and coating on the heat platen. The silicon rubber base is now glued down. This heat press is compact and is an upward-opening model, which saves space. Ideal for applying transfers, letters, numbers, and images on t-shirts, garments, bags, mouse mats, jigsaw puzzles, ID bages, ceramic tiles, and other items.
feature_bullets: Fancierstudio Power Heat Press 15 inch by 15 inch heat press. Voltage: 110V (standard US and Canada) .Power: 1400 watts, Heat Press Style: Clamshell, Temperature Range: 0-500 degrees F; Time Range:0-999 seconds, Electronic time and heat control; precise time set-up, Silicon-gel base board, Pressure adjustable. Teflon sheet included. Silicon pad lightly glued down not fully for purpose of replacement. Color of heat press is Blue Black Model: FS15x15 BB

To start off a successful t-shirt business, a heat transfer press is a very important piece of equipment. A t-shirt press machine being an integral component makes it important to select the best t-shirt heat press in the market.

This Fancierstudio power heat press works great in both commercial and domestic settings, and it can perform any size job with supreme durability. The easy to use design allows for sturdy operations. When pressed down, it provides industrial strength, pressure, and even temperature, guaranteeing the transfer to last on the garment.

This Fancierstudio Power Heat Press is easy to operate and provides professional results. If you're making shirts for your family or for your clients, the Fancierstudio Heat Press will make a lasting impression!

The Fancierstudio power heat press uses high temperatures and heavy pressure to embed the design onto the material permanently. For professionals especially, these machines are highly recommended instead of using irons. Irons cannot reach the high temperatures and pressure that a heat press machine can reach and sustain. Heat press machines typically require 350 to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
